DataElement.preferredDefinition: A pathology report provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. Report defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread. Essential information to be included in a pathology report: the date and name of the report, slide number, the source of the specimen, the primary tumor size, he histologic diagnosis including the grade or degree of differentiation, the extent of disease within and beyond the primary site._Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

Concepts.definition: A report that provides a description of the gross and microscopic examination of the specimen and is used to make a diagnosis and to determine treatment. It defines which structures and organs of the body are involved by the tumor, verifies the primary site of the cancer and describes the extent to which it has spread.

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
